sourceMeaningMnemonic: Using <radical>flowers</radical> to make a <radical>lip ring</radical> is always going to end in <kanji>frustration</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Have you ever made a daisy chain? Try making a daisy lip ring. Just imagine your frustation as you try to make it small enough to fit through your lip piercing.
readingMnemonic: After some <kanji>frustration</kanji>, you made your flower lip ring. Now you look like an <reading>Egy</reading>ptian  (<ja>いじ</ja>) pharaoh. Because all ancient Egyptian monarchs wore flower lip rings (historical fact)!
readingInfo: Imagine yourself dressed as an ancient Egyptian pharaoh, wearing your newly-crafted flower lip ring. Think how classy (or strange) you feel.
